Very interesting stories. I look forward to next year's contest. 

By the w=
ay, I know that I had a few mis-spellings and typos in my story,
"The Faith=
ful." Would it be all right to submit an edited version (I
won't change the=
 story itself) for posting on the site?

Thanks, Nina Boal

Here=
 are the results of the judging for the 2006 Samurai Fiction
contest:

Fist=
 Place: 

Gaki, by Jesse Workman (Genre: Ghost Story)

Runner up, and winne=
r of the Riccardo Tacchini Memorial Award -
Sponsored by Carlo "Tsubame" Ta=
cchini in memory of his brother:

The Faithful, by Nina Boal (Genre: Histor=
ical Fiction)

Honorable Mention: 

Massugu, by Andy Lowe (Genre: Pulp Fict=
ion)

There was a lot of debate over these three, and there wasn't really a=

clear cut winner until the very end.

All of the entries will be temporari=
ly housed here until I can created a
new webpage: 

http://www.samurai-arch=
ives.com/sfic06/samfic06.html

And for anyone interested in next year's con=
test, stay tuned for
updates!

Thanks!

C. West
